title: 111_hr899
content: The Act is titled the "Ethical and Legal Elections for Congressional Transitions Act" and requires a special election in case of a vacancy in the office of a Senator. The "Ethical and Legal Elections for Congressional Transitions Act" mandates a special election to fill a Senate vacancy. The President of the Senate certifies the vacancy, and the state's chief executive must hold a special election within 90 days. State laws govern the special election process, except in cases near a regularly scheduled election. The "Ethical and Legal Elections for Congressional Transitions Act" requires a special election to fill a Senate vacancy within 90 days of the vacancy being certified. State laws govern the special election process, except in cases near a regularly scheduled election. The Act also outlines rules for temporary appointments to fill the vacancy until the special election is held. The Help America Vote Act of 2002 amends the law to provide payments to states to reimburse a portion of the costs incurred in holding special elections to fill Senate vacancies. The Help America Vote Act of 2002 authorizes payments to states for holding special elections to fill Senate vacancies. States eligible for payment must submit cost details to receive 50% reimbursement. The Commission will reimburse states for 50% of the reasonable costs incurred in holding special elections, to be paid within 30 days of receiving the cost statement. States must agree to repay any excess payment received compared to the actual costs incurred. Authorization of appropriations for payments under this part is authorized for fiscal year 2009 and each succeeding fiscal year.
